bestPracticesList: All Principles for Digital Development have been followed in the conceptualisation, development and continued operation of Lexsitus. In addition, Lexsitus will not, in any manner whatsoever, harm the fundamental human rights of anyone as defined under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights. Moreover, Lexsitus will fully observe the principle of equality and non-discrimination and not in any way discriminate on the basis of grounds such as religion, race, ethnicity, nationality or sexual orientation. Furthermore, the platform will not in any way contribute to harm to our shared natural environment.

As a further principle, Lexsitus has been built to indefinitely provide free and quality legal education and information service to anyone with access to the Internet, regardless of their geographical location. Lexsitus will remain non-profit and open access. As such, Lexsitus is aligned with Goal 4 of the Sustainable Development Goals (‘SDGs’) (that is, it will 'ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all').

Furthermore, the service of Lexsitus is directly aimed at Goal 16 of the SDGs (that is, to “promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels”). Through the freely available educational and legal-information content, Lexsitus aims to equip individuals with knowledge of international criminal law, so they may ensure that there is accountability for core international crimes in their societies, organisations and countries.

preventHarm.additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies: Users cannot add content. There is an editorial team with strict control of publish ability.

typesOfDataCollected: Lexsitus can be used without registering. However, if users wish to use a reading list function, they can optionally register (https://cilrap-lexsitus.org/register).
There is also an optional 'Report Issue' function which registers name and e-mail address.

inappropriateIllegalContent.illegalContentDetectionMechanism: For the reasons explained above, no actor external to the Lexsitus team can add content to Lexsitus, and documents produced outside Lexsitus and subsequently added to it are official versions of judgments of international courts selected by the Lexsitus team. The work of members of the Lexsitus team are subjected to rigorous, multi-level quality-control. Working-level Lexsitus team-members cannot themselves publish material on Lexsitus. A small number of editors must approve and trigger all publication. All editors are accountable to the creator of Lexsitus, the Director of CILRAP. The editorial team is and will remain very small. All Lexsitus editors and other team members are lawyers, except the IT-experts of Mithya Labs who provide technical support and development work, and who are also accountable for all their work on Lexsitus to the Director of CILRAP. Any user of Lexsitus can report suspected issues (technical or content-wise) to the Lexsitus team through a designated feature. Lexsitus content has never been questioned.
